pageContext.claim: “Hispanic-American families saw their net worth skyrocket by 64%.”
pageContext.analysis: This increase is from a relatively small base and the Federal Reserve referenced this number in a report that discussed how the pre-pandemic economy had failed to narrow racial disparities in wealth and income. Median wealth for White families in 2019 was still much higher, at $188,200, compared with $24,100 for Black families and $36,200 for Hispanics. The median family income for whites grew 6%. For Black households, it was slightly better at 7%. For Hispanic families, incomes fell 1%. Median income for White families in 2019 was $69,000, compared with $40,300 for Black families and $40,700 for Hispanics.
